comments.body: shouldn't this be the v1 ParameterCodec? Also a number of times further down.
genericapiserver can handle any meta group defined.  We only have one today, but if we added a different group, then a server that supports meta/v2 would need the decoding.
again, this `metav1.ExportOptions` is actually the internal type which happens to be equal to metav1. Type aliases would be nice if our conversion handled those without performance hit (does it?).

The type alias doesn't matter - internal type isn't really a thing.  It's better to think of "I'm asking for a particular version of this struct", where someone else is responsible for hiding the details of giving you that version.  An external version is not special.  Creating a type alias is just a second form of alias that doesn't actually clear things up.  

The contract is "I take request parameters and give you back an object".  Internal version should look "special" or have a deeper reason to exist.  Just type aliasing it won't reduce that.
This more precisely a parameter groupversion, correct?
